text: - My name is Justiono Putro.
I'm a cloud infrastructure architect

with AWS Canada professional
service team for public sector.
I'm working primarily on a project
from customers in healthcare industry.
In the past, I've been working
on their data lake design project
as well as application modernization.
I'm impressed with how cloud technology

has turned IT infrastructures
in the data centers

of many organizations into
programmable resources.
Having an opportunity to learn about cloud
from inside for SAN from AWS
is like hitting a jackpot for me.
I keep hearing how AWS raised the bar,

and I imagine that it
would be a very hectic

and competitive workplace
and I keep asking myself

if I would be able to
survive in such environment.

It turns out that AWS has a
very supportive environment.

I always have enough
time to learn what I need

to know to do the jobs,
and I have been always
be able to maintain a work life balance.
What I thought would be a very competitive
and hectic workplace is a very supportive
and enjoyable learning environment.
(bright lively music)
